definition: to tear open/to tear down/to tear apart/to open
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: The X-ray shows a fractured ankle.
sentences.chinese: 一週之後再來，我給你拆線。

sentences.english: Come back in a week and I’ll take your stiches out.
sentences.chinese: 一週之後再來，我給你拆線。

sentences.english: You must make marks clearly when the wires are disconnected.
sentences.chinese: 拆線時，你必須清楚地做下記號。

sentences.english: Come back in a week and I'll take your stiches out.
sentences.chinese: 一週之後再來，我給你拆線。

sentences.english: Then select the "stitches" layer again so that it is the active layer.
sentences.chinese: 再次，它是活性層，然後選擇“拆線”層。

sentences.english: This will add more depth and dimension to the stitches.
sentences.chinese: 這將增加更多的深度和維度拆線。

definition: to form a scar/to form a scab
to fill a tooth (cavity)/to have a tooth filled/a dental filling
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
